intro: Monnina oblanceolata, commonly known as prairie bluemink, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It produces small, bead-like fruits that contain a single seed. Monnina oblanceolata is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
